answers.answer: I did with my 1st. My uterus was measuring small I was 34 weeks but measuring 31/32. Everything was fine he was just fine in there had an ultrasound to check on him. Sometimes they get concerned if your measuring small that baby isnt getting what it needs from placenta to thrive so they arent growing. If that does end up being the case they may have to takr baby early.
They dont necessarily have to take the baby early, but they do monitor you closely and there is a chance that they may need to. My lo wasn't growing properly,  but managed ti keep her in til 38 wks

Ty for the responses ladies, I'm hoping everything turns out fine...I had a 7.2lb and an 8.8 lb one and I remember being huge with them. I'm just hoping it's just a smaller little guy and that he comes to full term. I have Gestational Diabetes so idk if that's a factor
I had my ob last Friday I was 25w4days n she measuring my 24 she said that good.

My 24 week drs appt my fundal height was smaller, I had a 31 week appt and my fundal height was a week ahead, I don't think it really matters, the baby could be curled up or stretched out and the measurements would be different so I wouldn't worry.

question: So I went for just a regular ob check up, when he measured my stomach he asked when was my last sonogram and if and when I was having another one...I told him my next one is on the 27th and to count 4weeks back and that's when I had my las sonogram. While I was leaving I heard him telling a student doctor that I was measuring 2-3 cm smaller and that since I was having a sonogram soon that they would see the size better then...has anyone measured smaller, what was going on, and what did your doctor say?
title: measuring smaller
